result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence D Austin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrence D Austin in court with attorney Sean Michael Brown.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to DRI the charge.
BTC: Case DRI.

ADDRESS INFO for Terrence D Austin
Current: 500 Greenfield Rd Apt 1, Racine, WI 53402 United States  (Effective: 03-24-2015)
Prior: 1709 Winslow St, Racine, WI 53404

Defendant Terrence D Austin in court with attorney Sean Michael Brown.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
BTC: adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Terrence D Austin
Current: 1709 Winslow St, Racine, WI 53404   (Effective: 01-28-2015)
Prior: 1709 Winslow St, Racine, MO 53404
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 26, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with victim store, Boston Store, except for restitution purposes.   No contact with the co-defendant, TM.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Terrence D Austin in court with attorney Sean Michael Brown.  Defendant Terrence D Austin in custody.  Eric P. Guttenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
